result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa C Soto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$150.00 BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any JC Penny Store or the witness.
Attend Anger Management course.

records.addlTxt: with certificate

Defendant Melissa C Soto in court with attorney Andres Velez.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing hearing. State presents arguments. Defense presents arguments. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 1 days)
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with any JC Penney store or the witness
*Attend Anger Management course 
*Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 90 days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
